As of September 9, bars, nightclubs and rum-shops remain close, social gatherings and home parties remain prohibited with the exception of funerals where a maximum of 25 people is allowed. In addition, masks are mandatory on all public locations, churches remain under the restrictive protocols, and visits and admissions to elderly care and nursing homes remain prohibited.  https://web.archive.org/web/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
Masks must be worn on public transportation    https://web.archive.org/web/20200916144011/https://www.arubacovid19.org/ddg

According to multiple national and international outlets, international and domestic commercial flights to and from Argentina could restart in October.  Mario Meoni, Minister of Transportation, said that health and safety protocols are ready, but that the President Alberto FernÃ¡ndez was yet to make a final decision, which should happen in the coming days.  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200909160851/https://www.batimes.com.ar/news/economy/commercial-flights-to-and-from-argentina-could-restart-in-october.phtml

On 18 September, The Government announced the further extension of the existing lockdown measures until 11 October.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200921204618/https://www.infobae.com/politica/2020/09/20/los-detalles-del-nuevo-decreto-del-gobierno-que-extiende-la-cuarentena-hasta-el-11-de-octubre/

The new measures maintain the restriction of up to 10 people gathered in outdoor public spaces.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200921204618/https://www.infobae.com/politica/2020/09/20/los-detalles-del-nuevo-decreto-del-gobierno-que-extiende-la-cuarentena-hasta-el-11-de-octubre/

No changes found on contact tracing policy

"The Central Bank of Belize has adopted prudential measures to maintain the flow of credit in the economy: (i) reducing the statutory cash reserve requirements; (ii) extending the time period to classify targeted non-performing loans in sectors such as restaurants, transportation and distribution companies, and other affected areas, from 3 months to 6 months; (iii) encouraging domestic banks and credit unions to provide grace periods for servicing interest and/or principal of commercial and ancillary loans, as needed and where commercially viable; (iv) reducing risk-weights for banks on loans in the tourism sector from 100 percent to 50 percent; and (v) reviewing financial institutionsâ business continuity and cyber security plans to ensure that an adequate level of financial services will be available to the public."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200914083810/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

From 1-30 September, the following restrictions are maintained: suspension of in-person classes, and public events (cultural, sports, holidays and political). In addition, people and vehicle mobility is limited from Monday to Friday from 8:00 p.m. to 5:00 a.m., and on Saturdays and Sundays from 4:00 p.m. to 5:00 a.m.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200921214751/https://www.minsalud.gob.bo/4559-bolivia-iniciara-en-septiembre-la-transicion-hacia-la-fase-pos-confinamiento-y-de-vigilancia-comunitaria

"The Dominica Government today announced that all schools will reopen on September 7 as the island continues to implement measures to curb the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19) which has infected 18 people here."  âSo, we are hoping that by next week Monday, hopefully the guidelines will be in circulation (and) one of the areas we are going to be focusing upon very heavily during the academic year is that of hygiene and the importance of effective hygiene practicesâ¦and for that matter we will engage hygiene wardens to ensure that students do what they have to do in terms of entry at the school gates,â he said.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200917070003/http://www.jamaicaobserver.com/latestnews/Dominican_schools_to_reopen_September_7?profile=1754

"Businesses, shops, offices, churches, sports facilities and beauty salons are now operating normally without restriction, except for health protocols (physical distancing, hand sanitising, wearing face masks)"  https://web.archive.org/web/20200917070557/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/dominica/coronavirus
"A maximum of 250 persons may gather together at any one time"  https://web.archive.org/web/20200917070557/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/dominica/coronavirus

"Entry to Dominica  Borders and the Douglas Charles airport are now open for nationals and non-nationals arriving in Dominica.    Screening on arrival  Arrival protocols are in place. Arriving passengers must complete an online questionnaire 24 hours before arrival, and have a PCR swab test with a negative result taken up to 72 hours before arrival. A Rapid Diagnostic Test (RDT) will be taken on arrival. If the RDT is negative, then the traveller must self-isolate in a government operated or government certified facility for five days before having a further PCR test. If the RDT is positive, then a further PCR swab test will be carried out. This will be at the travellerâs expense.    If the PCR test is positive a mandatory 14 day quarantine will be necessary, in a government facility for which fees will be charged."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200917071430/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/dominica/entry-requirements

Until September 14th, The Dominican Republic is requiring visitors to present a negative COVID-19 test result in order to have freedom of movement in the country. Visitors must have proof of a negative polymerase chain reaction (PCR) or nasal swab test result recorded within five days of their arrival.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200911054747/https://www.traveloffpath.com/dominican-republic-reopening-to-tourists-july-1st/

10/09    In the permanent session of the National COE held on September 10, 2020, unanimously by the members, it was resolved to authorize under the figure of a pilot plan the applications submitted for the progressive return to face-to-face classes for the following establishments:    - Pachamama de CumbayÃ¡ School.  - SEK International School of Quito.  - SEK International School of Los Chillos.  - SEK International School of Guayaquil.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200918113926/https://www.primicias.ec/noticias/sociedad/coe-clases-presenciales-quito-guayaquil/    16/09     The Pachamama schools in CumbayÃ¡ and the SEK International in Quito , Los Valles and Guayaquil have the authorization of the National COE to apply their pilot plans of progressive return to face- to- face classes . The return will also depend on the decision of the Cantonal COE . In Guayaquil , this entity did not give way to the application of the pilot plan of another institution that received approval from the national authority, so the proposal has not been applied and the classes continue to be developed in a 100% virtual way.     Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200918113838/https://www.elcomercio.com/actualidad/quito-colegio-autorizacion-clases-presenciales.html

International and domestic commercial flights resumed limited operations on June 1. All arriving passengers must present a negative Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) COVID-19 test taken up to ten days prior to departure, and if unable to do so passengers will be required to take a test at the airport. All passengers are required to complete a declaration form providing their itinerary and contact details and will be subject to a mandatory 10-day self-isolation period. Land and sea borders remain closed, except for the border posts of Rumichara with Colombia and Huaquillas with Peru, which are open only to residents.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200918124135/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/379341/ecuador-authorities-lift-state-of-emergency-and-additional-restrictions-september-14-update-16

The benefits of the Humanitarian Support Law for people who have problems complying with payments for basic services, insurance, rent or bank loans are tied to the duration of the state of exception that applies until next Sunday, September 13, 2020. After the Government confirmed that it will not extend this decision beyond that date, by a ruling of the Constitutional Court , the benefits of the Law now have a final effective date.    Most benefits remain active until November:    - During the period of validity of the state of emergency and up to 60 days after its end, that is, until November 12, 2020, all entities of the national financial system (including credit cards and commercial houses) will have to reschedule the collection of loan installments. The latter may include an extension of payment or rescheduling of fees.  - From the effective date of the state of emergency and up to one year later, the Law prohibits the increase in values, rates or rates of basic services and telecommunications. This means that rates cannot go up until September 13, 2021.  -All companies that provide basic services (water, electricity and telephone) and telecommunications (mobile telephone and Internet ) will not suspend the cuts due to non-payment while the state of ct until November 12, 2020.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200918132739/https://www.elcomercio.com/actualidad/prohibicion-desalojo-arriendos-servicios-pandemia.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20200918133529/https://www.expreso.ec/actualidad/excepcion-deudas-pagos-acecharan-13-noviembre-89937.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20200918133549/https://www.eluniverso.com/noticias/2020/09/10/nota/7973194/que-derechos-ciudadanos-o-servicios-quedan-protegidos-tras-fin

On Monday, September 14, authorities lifted the national state of emergency initially declared in March in response to the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic.     Public gatherings remain prohibited, though the ban on social gatherings has been lifted and will be determined by local municipalities. Public shows, bars, and nightclubs remain closed.     Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200918161020/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/379341/ecuador-authorities-lift-state-of-emergency-and-additional-restrictions-september-14-update-16

On Monday, September 14, authorities lifted the national state of emergency initially declared in March in response to the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic.     Public gatherings remain prohibited, though the ban on social gatherings has been lifted and will be determined by local municipalities. Individuals are permitted to move freely within the country, limitations on public transportation will be applied and movement for individual vehicles will continue to be limited according to the last number of vehicle license plates. Public shows, bars, and nightclubs remain closed. The use of beaches will be permitted, though they will be regulated by local authorities likely limiting capacity numbers.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200918161020/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/379341/ecuador-authorities-lift-state-of-emergency-and-additional-restrictions-september-14-update-16

On Monday, September 14, authorities lifted the national state of emergency initially declared in March in response to the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic. Lockdown restrictions, including a nightly curfew, in place to curb the spread of COVID-19, were also lifted.    Public gatherings remain prohibited, though the ban on social gatherings has been lifted and will be determined by local municipalities. Family or executive meetings of up to 25 people are also authorized.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200918194527/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/379341/ecuador-authorities-lift-state-of-emergency-and-additional-restrictions-september-14-update-16  https://web.archive.org/web/20200918201053/https://www.elcomercio.com/actualidad/coe-normas-municipios-excepcion.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20200918202110/https://www.elvocero.com/el-mundo/ecuador-flexibiliza-restricciones-por-el-covid-19/article_7a63fcec-f6be-11ea-bdb9-9fd72811694d.html

On Monday, September 14, authorities lifted the national state of emergency initially declared in March in response to the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic. Each municipal government will be responsible in determining measures such as maximum capacities for public transport and institutions, operational capacity of private businesses, the circulation of private vehicles against license plate numbers, health prevention protocols for businesses and industries, amongst others.    Public and commercial transport is authorized with up to 75 percent of the passenger capacity.    In Quito, due to a high COVID-19 infection rate, many restrictions will remain in place. Public transport, including terminals and tourist transport, at a maximum 50 percent capacity.    Link:   https://web.archive.org/web/20200918194539/https://www.expreso.ec/actualidad/esto-podra-quito-partir-13-septiembre-89781.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20200918194558/https://www.gestionderiesgos.gob.ec/resoluciones-coe-nacional-11-de-septiembre-2020/  https://web.archive.org/web/20200918194527/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/379341/ecuador-authorities-lift-state-of-emergency-and-additional-restrictions-september-14-update-16.

On Monday, September 14, authorities lifted the national state of emergency initially declared in March in response to the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic. Lockdown restrictions, including a nightly curfew, in place to curb the spread of COVID-19, were also lifted. The prohibition of private meetings will no longer be in force.     The COE recalled that neither national nor local authorities may restrict free movement and association.    Individuals will continue to be required to wear face masks in public areas, and to comply with social distancing measures (maintain a 2m (6ft) distance) and practise frequent hand washing.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200918194527/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/379341/ecuador-authorities-lift-state-of-emergency-and-additional-restrictions-september-14-update-16  https://web.archive.org/web/20200918201053/https://www.elcomercio.com/actualidad/coe-normas-municipios-excepcion.html

On Monday, September 14, authorities lifted the national state of emergency initially declared in March in response to the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic. Each municipal government will be responsible in determining measures such as maximum capacities for public transport and institutions, operational capacity of private businesses, the circulation of private vehicles against license plate numbers, health prevention protocols for businesses and industries, amongst others.    Individuals are permitted to move freely within the country.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200918194527/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/379341/ecuador-authorities-lift-state-of-emergency-and-additional-restrictions-september-14-update-16

As of 20 September, schools remain closed. However, there are plans to resume in-person teaching in October.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200921210413/https://www.prensalibre.com/guatemala/comunitario/coronavirus-en-guatemala-coprecovid-alista-estrategia-para-apertura-de-universidades-colegios-y-escuelas/

Government officials are still allowed to work between the hours of 7:00 (local time) and 15:00, while office workers in the private sector are permitted to work between 09:00 and 17:00.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200921210904/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/381321/guatemala-authorities-extend-covid-19-measures-until-september-28-update-22

Public events remain banned in the country    http://web.archive.org/web/20200921210413/https://www.prensalibre.com/guatemala/comunitario/coronavirus-en-guatemala-coprecovid-alista-estrategia-para-apertura-de-universidades-colegios-y-escuelas/

National commercial flights have also been resumed in the country from 18 September.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200921212831/https://www.prensalibre.com/guatemala/comunitario/en-imagenes-a-dos-dias-de-su-reapertura-asi-luce-el-aeropuerto-internacional-la-aurora/

After six months of closure, Guatemala's air, land, and sea borders reopened on Friday, 18 September. All travelers must present a negative PCR test taken within the 72 hours prior to arrival or undertake a 14-day quarantine.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200921211812/https://republica.gt/2020/09/18/cuales-son-los-requisitos-para-ingresar-en-guatemala-por-la-pandemia-del-covid-19/

Education Minister Priya Manickchand, says that schools will not reopen on September 7 as a result of the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200908162117/https://www.caribbeannationalweekly.com/caribbean-breaking-news-featured/schools-in-guyana-will-not-reopen-in-september/

"This training programme comes after Minister Manickchandâs announcement on Friday that notwithstanding school buildings will remain closed, come Monday, the Ministry will be re-engaging students in education delivery using âa blended multifaceted approachâ that will incorporate teaching via various Internet platforms, among them the Learning Channel, radio, and print materials that will be distributed to all students.  The recommencement of teaching is geared at reducing learning loss for the students, as schools having been closed since March 16. Though cognisant of the difficulties facing many teachers, the Minister noted that teachers, to the best of their abilities, are expected to play their part in the scheme of things.  Conscious of the inability to navigate many virtual platforms, the Ministry has therefore decided to train the teachers accordingly."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200921153650/https://guyanachronicle.com/2020/09/16/chalk-and-talk-days-soon-over/

"(1) All persons employed within the Public Service.... shall not work remotely from home but shall work on rotation...    (2) Private sector entities may be opened but employees shall work on rotation as determined by their employer"    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200921120333/https://www.health.gov.gy/images/Extra_31AUGUST2020COViD_Not9.pdf

"Restrictioin on Social Activities  No person shall host, attend or visit -    (a) a cinema;  (b) a private party;  (c) a competitive sporting event  ...  (k) a meeting of a fraternal society, private or social club or civic association or organisation; or  (l) any other social activity."    Source:http://web.archive.org/web/20200921120333/https://www.health.gov.gy/images/Extra_31AUGUST2020COViD_Not9.pdf

"Except for religious services and gatherings permitted under paragraph 11, where gatherings are allowed it shall not exceed ten persons"    Note: In Regions 7,8 & 9 - "Gatherings shall not exceed five persons"    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200921120333/https://www.health.gov.gy/images/Extra_31AUGUST2020COViD_Not9.pdf

"A motor vehicle, vessel or aircraft shall not be used for a purpose other than a purpose related to a service under paragraphs 5 and 6"    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200921120333/https://www.health.gov.gy/images/Extra_31AUGUST2020COViD_Not9.pdf

"In accordance with the curfews under paragraph 4 and except as otherwise provided in this Notice, every person shall remain in the confines of his or her home and its yard space"    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200921120333/https://www.health.gov.gy/images/Extra_31AUGUST2020COViD_Not9.pdf

"Any person who provides transport within Guyana whether by land, water or air shall not carry in that transport more than 75% the number of passengers which the motor vehicle, vessel or aircraft is licensed to carry and the operators and passengers of any motor vehicle, vessel or aircraft shall wear personal protective equipment while in the vehicle, vessel or aircraft"    Source:http://web.archive.org/web/20200921120333/https://www.health.gov.gy/images/Extra_31AUGUST2020COViD_Not9.pdf    Source:http://web.archive.org/web/20200921120333/https://www.health.gov.gy/images/Extra_31AUGUST2020COViD_Not9.pdf

"In response to the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic, all scheduled international flights from the Cheddi Jagan International Airport at Timehri and the Eugene Correia Airport at Ogle have been cancelled for the foreseeable future. The closure started on 17 March 2020 and is scheduled to last until at least 1 August. Some repatriation charter flights and other specially authorised flights are being allowed to arrive and leave Guyana.    The National COVID-19 Task Force have said that anyone entering Guyana must be in possession of a current COVID-19 PCR test laboratory certificate."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200921152653/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/guyana/entry-requirements  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200921120333/https://www.health.gov.gy/images/Extra_31AUGUST2020COViD_Not9.pdf

No new update. Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200917123816/https://health.gov.gy/

"In August, when there was a backlog of samples, the Ministry had restricted testing to symptomatic persons and those who might have been in contact or exposed to a person who tested positive for the disease. Walk-in patients were urged to follow preventative guidelines and to self-quarantine until a period of time had elapsed and they showed no severe signs or symptoms.    Hospitalised persons who were never tested for COVID-19 were given priority to undergo testing and obtain their results. Additionally, frontline workers are being prioritised for tests and results as they are among those likely to have been exposed to positive cases."    Note: this policy is related to a change of government    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200921161738/https://guyanachronicle.com/2020/09/19/dr-anthony-budget-2020-will-resuscitate-the-health-sector/

"Authorities have expressed condolences to the family of the deceased, and promised to make every effort to provide all the necessary support during this difficult time.  Officials of the Ministry of Health have also confirmed that they contacted all relatives and persons to facilitate contact tracing and rapid assistance to everyone who might have been exposed to the victim."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200921161528/https://guyanachronicle.com/2020/09/21/101-new-covid-19-cases-in-24-hours/

'Persons in public spaces will not be allowed to gather in groups exceeding 15 persons [reduced from 20] as of Tuesday, September 8, 2020, ending Tuesday, September 22, 2020.' This includes the place of worship and funerals.    https://archive.vn/dRwtR

Curfew was extended from [9pm-5am] to [8pm-5am] on 8 September. It is effective until 23 September.    https://archive.vn/dRwtR

The Ministry of Health and Wellness of Jamaica on 17 September announced that antigen testing for COVID-19 will begin in late October.  'The test â which will be administered only to symptomatic patients while serving as a complement to the current gold standard in testing, the PCR test â is to be piloted in major hospitals by the National Public Health Laboratory. Full implementation will follow in other hospitals and health centres, and by private laboratory operators.'    https://archive.vn/cJUBJ

On 11 September, the state of Colima --the last one remaining under the "red" risk classification-- was moved to a less stringent "orange" category. This means that most states have resumed non-essential activities, though at a limited 30% capacity in those in the "orange" group.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200918011952/https://coronavirus.gob.mx/datos/    http://web.archive.org/web/20200918012731/https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/estados/semaforo-covid-19-colima-pasa-a-color-naranja-actividades-permitidas-del-14-al-27-de-septiembre/

According to the US Embassy: "On September 14, the following changes in movement restrictions will be implemented: Gender-based movement restrictions are lifted and âsalvoconductosâ become null and void, except for those occupations that require movement during curfew hours.
